column1: Entwives were the mates of the Ents. The Entwives were dedicated to Yavanna. They had gardens in the regions later known as the Brown Lands
column2: and their agricultural knowledge was passed on to Men and Hobbits.

column1: During the First Age or the Second Age they started to move farther away from the male Ents because they liked to plant and control small things like vegetables
column3: while the male Ents tended the larger trees of the great forest. The Entwives passed eastward over the Anduin and went to the region that would later become the Brown Lands. After Morgoth was overthrown
column4: their gardens blossomed and they taught agriculture to the primitive Men and they honored them.

column1: When Sauron burned that region to stop the advance of the Last Alliance of Elves and Men down the Anduin
column2: the Entwives were likely wiped out
column3: although some might have been captured and enslaved as agricultural workers or have escaped into the east of Middle-earth. The Ents held that the Entwives were lost.

column1: Treebeard would tell Meriadoc Brandybuck and Peregrin Took that the Entwives would love their country. Indeed sometime before the War of the Ring
column2: Halfast Gamgee claimed that he saw an Elms-like "Tree-Man" walking in the North Moors. However
column3: it was never learned whether the "Tree-Man" was an Ent
